definition: third and fourth lines (in an eight-line poem) which form a couplet
to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet
antithesis (two lines of poetry matching in sense and sound)/to fight/to wage war
writing style in which the main subject is approached directly from the outset/opposite of 冒題|冒题[mao4 ti2]
(literary) to end/to stop/one of the stanzas (usually two) of a ci poem 詞|词[ci2]/classifier for songs or ci poems
to put pen to paper/pen mark
to touch up (a piece of writing)/to add details (to a painting)
variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
old verse/poetry in the old style
vigor of strokes in calligraphy or drawing/vigor of style in literary composition
